Interaction_APPEARED_TOGETHER.context: Discussing the Ring and Frodo's departure

Event_CAUSED.method: Bilbo's possession of the Ring and his conversation with Gandalf prompted Gandalf's warning to Frodo.
Gandalf revealed the Ring's nature and advised Frodo to leave.
Gandalf's warning and advice led to Frodo's decision to leave the Shire.
Frodo decided to leave the Shire.
Sauron sent the Black Riders to search for the Ring.
Tom invited and sheltered the hobbits.
The hobbits strayed into the Barrow-downs.
Frodo accidentally put on the Ring.
Sauron sent Black Riders to attack Crickhollow.
Boromir tried to take the Ring from Frodo.

Event_AFFECTED_BY.impact: Left Bag End and the Shire
Learned the true nature of the ring and the danger it poses
Fell asleep under the influence of Old Man Willow
Trapped in a crack of Old Man Willow
Pulled into a crack of Old Man Willow
Felt worried and uneasy about the willow tree and his companions' sudden sleepiness
Pushed into the river by Old Man Willow
Overcome by the Black Breath and fell
Fell into the abyss while fighting the Balrog
Distressed and troubled by Boromir's attempt to take the Ring

Event_DIED_AT.impact: Frodo became an orphan and was raised by Brandybucks.
Frodo became an orphan and was raised by Brandybucks.
The One Ring was lost in the Anduin.
Ended the attempt to retake Moria.

Event_DIED_AT.cause: Taken by the Watcher in the Water
Fell into abyss fighting a Balrog
Event_DIED_AT.impact: The Company lost their leader and guide.

Item_CREATED.purpose: To control all other Rings of Power

Item_SEEKS.motivation: To reclaim the treasure of his ancestors
To destroy it and defeat Sauron
To regain his full power and control Middle-earth
To escape from Gollum and the orcs
To use its power to defend Gondor and defeat Sauron
To keep it from falling into the hands of the Enemy

Item_USED_IN.significance: Marks Bilbo's final departure from the Shire
Raises suspicion and reveals Frodo's possession of a magic ring
Shows Tom Bombadil's immunity to the Ring's power
Confirms to Frodo that the ring works, but Tom Bombadil is unaffected
Makes Frodo visible to the Ringwraiths and nearly leads to his capture
Part of the defense of Weathertop
Wounds the Witch-king, but the blade breaks
Reveals Frodo to the Ringwraiths, but he escapes due to Glorfindel and the flood
Allows the Company to escape the Chamber of Mazarbul
A brave but futile gesture against a powerful foe
A duel between two powerful beings
Causes the Balrog to fall, but Gandalf falls with it
Saves the Company from an unknown threat
